subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: Roman Religion: Gods for Every Occasion
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Roman Religion: Gods for Every Occasion.

hook.text: Romans had a god for doors, a god for hinges, and a god for thresholds. Their religion was practical, not spiritual.

buildup.text: Roman religion was a contract: perform the right ritual, and the gods owe you. Skip it, and expect disaster.

discovery.text: Romans freely adopted foreign gods. They absorbed Greek, Egyptian, and Persian deities without embarrassment.

twist.text: Emperor worship made politics and religion one. Refusing to sacrifice to the emperor was treason, not just heresy.

climax.text: Roman religion was flexible enough to absorb the world but brittle enough to shatter when Christianity arrived.

punchline.text: Rome had gods for everything, even hinges. Practical faith, not spiritual.

quiz.question: What was the nature of Roman religion?
